1. Nf3 f6 2. Nc3 Nh6 3. g4 c6 4. d4 e6 5. Ng5 f5 6. e4

Note that, to prove atomic is a draw, we only need to look at one strong move for black at each black turn.
But we need to look at all the possible strong moves for white when it is white's turn.
  • 1. Nf3
    • 1 ... f6
      • 2. Nc3
        • 2 ... Nh6
          • 3. g4
            • 3 ... c6
              • 4. d4
                • 4 ... e6
                  • 5. e4
                  • 5. Ng5
                    • 5 ... f5
                      • 6. e4
                        • 6 ... Bd6
                          • 7. e5
                            • 7 ... Na6
                              • 8. a3 =
                              • 8. Na4
                              • 8. Bxa6
                          • 7. d5
                          • 7. Nb5
                          • 7. Na4
                            • 7 ... Bf4 8. Be3
                              • 8 ... Na6
          • 3. h3
          • 3. Ne5 fxe5
      • 2. Nd4
        • 2 ... Nh6
          • 3. Nf5 Nxf5
          • 3. e3
            • 3 ... Ng4 4. f4
              • 4 ... b5
                • 5. Nf5
                  • 5 ... e5
                    • 6. Bd3
                      • 6 ... Bb4
                        • 7. c3
                          • 7 ... Bxc3
                            • 8. Qb3 d5
                              • 9. Qa3
                            • 8. Qc2
                        • 7. Bxb5
                    • 6. Ne7
                • 5. h3
                • 5. Bd3
          • 3. e4
          • 3. h3
          • 3. g4
          • 3. f3
      • 2. Ne5 fxe5
      • 2. Na3
      • 2. d4
      • 2. e4
      • 2. e3
        • 2 ... d5
      • 2. c3

6. e4
